page.title: 18HEALTH - OWERSBY
page.content: The National Health Service provides 2 clinics that local residents might at- tend,Market Rasen or Caistor.Here one may visit the doctor of one's choice. House calls are made by the doctors & the district nurse to house-bound pat- ients.Mothers and small babies are al- so visited by the district nurse.Mat- ernity hospitals are 20 miles away in Grimsby or Lincoln.Ambulance services are provided for outpatients and for long term stay patients.Current pre- scriptions cost Â£2 each. Pensioners and children under 16 yrs. are not charged.They also receive dental and optical care free.Both are available in Market Rasen but many prefer to travel to Lincoln or Grimsby.There is no specialist help locally for resid- ents with physical and mental handi- caps eg blindnes.
